author: Jornal i
title: Papa Francisco não conduzirá orações dominicais pela segunda semana
text:
Papa Francisco não conduzirá orações dominicais pela segunda semana Jornal i © AFP 22/02/2025 17:30 Apesar de não estar presente, o texto da sua reflexão tornar-se-á público, como ocorreu no domingo passado.
O Papa Francisco, de 88 anos, está hospitalizado desde a passada sexta-feira com uma pneumonia bilateral no Hospital Gemelli, em Roma.
No relatório médico divulgado na quarta-feira, o Vaticano disse que este se encontrava «estável» e apresentava «uma ligeira melhoria, sobretudo nos índices inflamatórios», após terem avisado a imprensa para o quadro «complexo» do bispo de Roma.
Fontes do Vaticano afirmaram ainda que, apesar da doença, o Papa mantém-se de «bom humor», informado e tem tentado trabalhar: lê e assina documentos, escreve e conversa com os seus colaboradores. Chegou mesmo a receber a primeira-ministra italiana, Giorgia Meloni, «com quem conversou de forma privada por 20 minutos».
No entanto, não há previsão sobre a sua alta hospitalar. Por isso, a sua agenda mantém-se em branco para as próximas semanas e vai estar ausente nas celebrações do Jubileu dos Diáconos, este fim de semana, por recomendações médicas de «repouso absoluto».
Segundo o Vatican News, com a hospitalização de Francisco no Policlínico Gemelli – dando continuidade assim às precauções adotadas como explicado na sexta-feira pela equipa médica que o assiste – os compromissos previstos para amanhã «seguirão o mesmo procedimento da semana precedente».
Por isso, informa a Sala de Imprensa do Vaticano — que nesta manhã informou via Telegram que o Papa ‘descansou bem’ — Francisco não conduzirá a oração do Angelus ao meio-dia. No entanto, o texto da sua reflexão tornar-se-á público, como ocorreu no domingo passado. O celebrante será o arcebispo Rino Fisichella que lerá o texto de Francisco.

author: 小浪财讯
title: 生物科技ETF（159837）跌0.73%，成交额3368.23万元_新浪财经_新浪网
text:
8月14日，易方达中证生物科技主题ETF（159837）收盘跌0.73%，成交额3368.23万元。
生物科技ETF（159837）成立于2021年1月14日，基金全称为易方达中证生物科技主题交易型开放式指数证券投资基金，基金简称为易方达中证生物科技主题ETF。该基金管理费率每年0.15%，托管费率每年0.05%。生物科技ETF（159837）业绩比较基准为中证生物科技主题指数收益率。
规模方面，截止8月13日，生物科技ETF（159837）最新份额为23.28亿份，最新规模为12.80亿元。回顾2024年12月31日，生物科技ETF（159837）份额为29.12亿份，规模为12.79亿元。即该基金今年以来份额减少20.05%，规模增加0.11%。
流动性方面，截止8月14日，生物科技ETF（159837）近20个交易日累计成交金额8.65亿元，日均成交金额4325.09万元；今年以来，150个交易日，累计成交金额40.78亿元，日均成交金额2718.69万元。
生物科技ETF（159837）现任基金经理为张湛。张湛自2021年1月14日管理（或拟管理）该基金，任职期内收益-45.00%。
最新定期报告显示，生物科技ETF（159837）重仓股包括 药明康德 、 恒瑞医药 、 迈瑞医疗 、 上海莱士 、 长春高新 、 复星医药 、 泰格医药 、 百济神州 、 智飞生物 、 万泰生物 ，持仓占比如下。 股票代码 股票名称 持仓占比 持仓股数（股） 持仓市值（元） 603259 药明康德 10.93% 194.86万 1.36亿 600276 恒瑞医药 9.73% 232.36万 1.21亿 300760 迈瑞医疗 9.72% 53.58万 1.20亿 002252 上海莱士 4.16% 751.21万 5160.82万 000661 长春高新 3.69% 46.10万 4571.78万 600196 复星医药 3.64% 179.69万 4508.39万 300347 泰格医药 3.14% 72.98万 3891.40万 688235 百济神州 3.08% 16.36万 3823.33万 300122 智飞生物 2.67% 169.24万 3315.44万 603392 万泰生物 2.64% 53.60万 3269.62万

author: David Linton dlinton@thesunchronicle.com
title: Phish foundation to team up with Keep Mansfield Beautiful to clean up downtown | Local News | thesunchronicle.com
text: MANSFIELD -- When the band Phish comes to town this weekend to play at the Xfinity Center they will not only play music, but members of its charity will be teaming up to clean up downtown. About 40 members of the band’s [WaterWheel Foundation](http://www.waterwheelfoundation.org) will be joining with [Keep Mansfield Beautiful](http://www.keepmansfieldbeautiful.com) on Saturday for a community cleanup event, Keep Mansfield Beautiful board member Danielle Dupre said in an email.

author: OpIndia Staff
title: Canada: Bullets fired at house of Laxmi Narayan Temple president’s son, Hindu temple has been under target of Khalistanis
text:
In a shocking incident, Khalistani terrorists reportedly targeted Satish Kumar, the president of Lakshmi Narayan Temple in Surrey, Canada on December 27. The attackers shot at least 14 rounds of fire at the house of Kumar’s son.
The incident unfolded at around 8:03 a.m. on December 27 in the 14900 block of 80 Avenue, India Today
reported. According to a Surrey Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) statement, the targeted residence belongs to the family of Satish Kumar, the president of the Lakshmi Narayan Mandir in Surrey.
The president of a major Hindu temple, Satish Kumar of Lakshmi Narayan Mandir in Surrey, Canada, was attacked by Khalistani supporters. His house was targeted with at least 14 rounds fired last night.— TIMES NOW (@TimesNow)
[@RishabhMPratap]with the latest updates. [pic.twitter.com/jLZvvi58ld] [December 29, 2023]
Satish Kumar told India Today that his son’s house was attacked and at least 14 shots were fired at it. No one was hurt in the shooting, but the house was damaged by bullet holes. “I can’t say whether (the attack) was by Khalistanis or some extortionist. Police are investigating the case,” said Kumar, adding that the temple was also targeted by alleged Khalistani activists in the past.
Police remained on the site for several hours, reviewing evidence, questioning witnesses, and combing the area for possible CCTV footage.
The Surrey RCMP General Investigation Unit has taken over the case, and police are probing the motive behind the attack. Reports
suggest that the attack was in retaliation for the temple’s stance against Khalistani Extremist fanatics. Last month, when Khalistani radicals assembled to attack the temple buildings, a counter-protest was held at this temple.
As reported earlier, the Khalistani elements
harassed the Hindu devotees outside Laxmi Narayan Mandir in Surrey in Canada on November 27, 2023, prompting the Hindu community to respond with a peaceful counter-protest. Hindu protestors waved religious saffron flags with Om printed on them and chanted Vande Mataram while the patriotic song played in the background. They also raised anti-Khalistan slogans such as ‘Neem Ka Patta Kadwa Hai, Khalistani bha*wa hai’, ‘Khalistan is porkistan’ and others. This is the third time Khalistan supporters have attacked the Lakshmi Narayan temple or its members.

author: @cronista
title: La BEBIDA "todo terreno" que CURA más de 10 MALES: daños cognitivos, controla las hormonas y problemas para dormir - El Cronista
text:
En esta noticia La milagrosa bebida a base de salvia que cura innumerables males ¿Cómo preparar un té de salvia en casa? Dejamos de lado el misterio para hablarte de la salvia . Esta noble planta, perteneciente a la familia lamiáceas, se lleva los honores por ser una de las pocas hierbas medicinales que está al servicio de la medicina , pero pocas personas valoran su alto poder curativo .
La salvia , venerada por siglos por sus propiedades medicinales , emerge como un elixir rejuvenecedor en el ámbito de la salud . Esta planta, que suele crecer de forma fácil en viveros, calles, campos y jardines, revela su poder en una nueva forma: el té .
Hojas salvia cerca montón idea salvia fresca. Fuente: Freepik. El postre de chocolate para quienes quieren bajar de peso: receta hecha por expertos
Bajar de peso con semillas de moringa: se reveló el secreto
Al transformarse en infusión, la salvia despliega sus compuestos antioxidantes, antiinflamatorios
La milagrosa bebida a base de salvia que cura innumerables males Diversos estudios científicos y de campo respaldan los resultados de la salvia como gran protector del sistema inmune . Ya te hemos adelantado algunos de los beneficios de la salvia, ahora vamos a darte el listado completo.
Té de salvia. Fuente: Archivo.
Limpia la sangre reduciendo toxinas y glucosa Combate el dolor de muela Alivia los trastornos digestivos Funciona como blanqueador natural de los dientes Combate los desórdenes hormonales causados por el estrés, la dietas y disruptores endocrinos o EDCs Reduce la sudoración al dormir y al exceso de salivación Estimula la grelina, la hormona encargada de generar la sensación de hambre Tiene poderes antiinflamatorios Funciona como antioxidante Mejora la salud cognitiva a largo plazo
Hierbas medicinales. Fuente: Freepik. El uso medicinal de la salvia también se aplica en la cavidad bucal, donde suelen crearse con frecuencias laceraciones, heridas , llagas, o encías inflamadas . Su uso natural puede resultar provecho gracias a su poder antimicótico.
En su uso más rural, las antiguas sociedades solían darla a masticar algunas hojas de salvia a las personas de su familia que tenía alguna de estas molestias.
El té de salvia , derivado de la Salvia divinorum , puede inducir alucinaciones intensas y debilitantes. Su abuso, especialmente cuando se fuma, incluso en pequeñas cantidades, puede afectar percepciones y sentidos.
Aquellos con historial de problemas de salud mental, mujeres embarazadas, o personas propensas a trastornos psicológicos deben evitarla. La supervisión médica es esencial, ya que el uso incontrolado puede resultar perjudicial y causar daño a uno mismo o a otros.
Té o bebida caliente para aliviar varios males. Fuente: Freepik. ¿Cómo preparar un té de salvia en casa? Los té de salvia n o son comunes y/o fáciles de conseguir, pero, puedes seguir está fácil técnica para realizar tu bebida en casa.
Hierve agua. Coloca hojas de salvia fresca o seca en una taza (1-2 cucharaditas). Vierte el agua caliente sobre las hojas. Deja reposar durante 5-7 minutos. Cuela las hojas. Opcional: Agrega miel o limón al gusto.
Rico té de salvia. Fuente: Archivo. Así de fácil puedes disfrutar de tu té de salvia . Ten en cuenta que su consumo en grandes cantidades puede tener efectos secundarios, y se recomienda moderación y consulta médica si hay preocupaciones de salud.

author: Aziz Malick Diallo
title: Soudan : intensification des combats dans la capitale Khartoum
text: Le Soudan, ravagé par la guerre depuis près d’un an et demi, a connu une nouvelle intensification des combats, ce 26 septembre 2024. Des frappes aériennes et des tirs d’artillerie ont secoué Khartoum, la capitale, où l’armée soudanaise mène une offensive de grande envergure contre les Forces de soutien rapide (FSR), une milice paramilitaire rivale. Alors que la situation au Soudan était au centre des discussions lors de l’Assemblée générale des Nations Unies, le 25 septembre, les affrontements ont éclaté, dès les premières heures du lendemain. À partir de 2 heures du matin, l’armée a lancé une attaque coordonnée sur plusieurs positions des FSR dans la capitale. Assaut qui marque un tournant important dans ce conflit meurtrier. Offensive militaire et positions stratégiques Les combats se sont concentrés sur des points névralgiques de Khartoum. Des témoins locaux ont rapporté de violents tirs d’artillerie et des bombardements aériens, particulièrement dans le centre-ville. Selon une source militaire, l’armée soudanaise a pris le contrôle de deux ponts stratégiques : le pont du Nil blanc et le pont McNimir, qui relient les zones sous contrôle de l’armée aux quartiers tenus par les FSR. L’armée a également progressé dans Bahri, un quartier nord de Khartoum où les forces paramilitaires du général Hemedti sont solidement implantées. Cette offensive est la première d’une telle ampleur depuis près de quatre mois. Ce qui marque la volonté de l’armée de reprendre le contrôle de la capitale, dont une grande partie reste dominée par les FSR. Une guerre qui dévaste le Soudan depuis 2023 Ce regain de violence intervient alors que le général Abdel Fattah al-Burhan, chef de l’armée soudanaise, intervient à la tribune de l’ONU. Ce conflit sanglant, qui oppose l’armée dirigée par al-Burhan aux FSR de son ancien allié, le général Mohamed Hamdane Dogolo, dit « Hemedti », a débuté le 15 avril 2023. Il est ponctué de violents combats qui plongent le pays dans le chaos. Les combats ont déjà causé des dizaines de milliers de morts et ont déplacé plus de 10 millions de personnes. Selon les [Nations Unies](https://www.afrik.com/soudan-guterres-exprime-sa-preoccupation-pour-el-fasher), près de la moitié de la population, soit environ 26 millions de Soudanais, souffrent actuellement d’une insécurité alimentaire sévère, exacerbée par la destruction des infrastructures et les affrontements incessants. Répercussions humanitaires et diplomatiques Cette offensive survient dans un contexte d’aggravation de la crise humanitaire au [Soudan](https://www.afrik.com/soudan). Alors que l’accès à l’aide humanitaire est entravé par les combats, les populations civiles continuent de payer le prix fort. Les destructions causées par les bombardements et les tirs d’artillerie ont notamment frappé des zones résidentielles, rendant encore plus difficile la situation pour les habitants de Khartoum, piégés entre deux feux. La communauté internationale, à travers les discussions à l’Assemblée générale des Nations unies, a réitéré son appel à un cessez-le-feu et à une résolution pacifique du conflit. Cependant, sur le terrain, l’escalade militaire semble se poursuivre. Une situation qui menace de prolonger encore davantage cette guerre destructrice qui déstabilise toute la région.

author: Signal Contributor
title: Mike Garcia | An Undeniable Crisis for Military
text: Sen. Tommy Tuberville and the Pentagon recently ended their social-policy war, and all Americans should be grateful to see this needless debacle come to an end. Sen. Tuberville’s blockade of military promotions – as well as the Pentagon’s perverse decision to wade into a live political fight – has received plenty of media attention. But while I’m glad to see this fiasco in the rear-view mirror, there’s no denying the damage that’s already been done. So, I’d like to refocus our attention on those most immediately and significantly impacted by this issue: Our brave men and women in uniform. Over the past two years, America’s military morale and readiness have declined to some of the lowest levels since World War II. Frankly, this should come as no surprise. In California, people flipping burgers at fast-food restaurants are getting paid more than troops willing to make the ultimate sacrifice for our freedom. Pentagon leaders are issuing guidance to troops on how to cope with inflation eating their paychecks. Army leaders are even suggesting that soldiers and their families consider going on food stamps. All of this comes at a time when our nation is facing problems of a magnitude unseen since the Axis of Evil. The Taliban and ISIS are unnecessarily emboldened, enriched, and energized in the wake of President Joe Biden’s disastrous Afghanistan withdrawal. That historic blunder opened the door for today’s escalating chaos: Russia invaded Ukraine; Iran-backed terrorists attacked Israel, our greatest ally; China is increasingly aggressive toward Taiwan; and North Korea is testing hypersonic missiles. This fractured state of the international stage makes America’s greatest national security asset – our men and women in uniform – more valuable than ever. Our commander in chief needs to start acting like it, but we can’t afford to sit and wait in the meantime. I’m doing everything in my power to ensure our troops and their families get the support they both need and deserve. Earlier this year, my bipartisan Military Spouse and Licensing Relief Act was signed into law. Now, over 250,000 active-duty military spouses who require professional credentials to work in education, medicine, real estate, and more can keep their jobs. The House-passed FY 2024 Defense Appropriations Act also includes my historic pay raise for our junior enlisted troops. The military relies on young Americans to sign up amid many other career opportunities. Simply put, it’s unacceptable that these brave men and women are making less than minimum wage. I won’t stop fighting until we right that wrong. Our military is in the middle of an undeniable crisis in recruitment, retention and morale. The most talented and experienced servicemembers may now decide that retirement sounds better than a promotion. The best and brightest of our next generation may now decide that flipping burgers sounds better than risking their lives in return for food stamps. We need to refocus our priorities before it’s too late. The Pentagon needs to stop infusing our military with partisanship and focus on its one true mission: Deter and win wars. The legislators in Washington need to stop grandstanding and focus on our one true mission: Find compromise and legislate on behalf of the American people. And the president simply must do more to support and inspire our troops. The most rewarding years of my life were spent fighting for our nation in uniform. It was an honor to fight alongside my fellow troops then, and now it’s my commitment to our troops and their families that I’ll never stop working to protect those who do so much to protect us. Rep. Mike Garcia, R-Santa Clarita, represents the 27th Congressional District, which includes the Santa Clarita and Antelope valleys. “Right Here, Right Now” appears Saturdays and rotates among local Republicans.
